Package controller

Class AddCustomer

java.lang.Object
controller.AddCustomer
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddCustomer extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This class controls the application window for the AddCustomer.fxml screen.

      public AddCustomer()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      The initialize method sets up the screen on launch. It initializes all necessary Observable Lists, and sets the items in the combo boxes. It also collects the user information from the Appointment View controller.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • onCountry

      public void onCountry(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The onCountry method sets the State/Province combo box to the correct list of states or provinces based on the country selected.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Country" selection click on the Add Customer screen.

    • onCancel

      public void onCancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      The onCancel method alerts the user that the customer information has not been saved and returns to Customer Records on confirmation.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Cancel" button click on the Add Customer screen.
      Throws:
      IOException - Signals that an IOException has occurred in the event an issue with loading CustomerRecords.fxml happens.

    • onSaveButton

      public void onSaveButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      The onSaveButton method collects all the information entered into the various fields and creates a new customer based on those fields. It then adds the new customer to the database. Error checking is in place to ensure the customer is complete. It then alerts the user that the customer has been saved and returns to Customer Records.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The "Save" button click on the Add Customer screen.
